heroIntro:
Discover your ideal retirement home in Mil Palmeras, Pilar de La Horadada. This premium 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom bungalow offers the perfect blend of comfort and value, priced at €349,000—remarkably 40% less than comparable properties on Spanish island markets. Spanning 63m² of thoughtfully designed living space, this property represents exceptional value at €5,540/m², compared to the area's €2,200/m² average.

Pilar de La Horadada has become increasingly popular with retirees seeking a peaceful, relaxed lifestyle without compromise on modern amenities or healthcare quality. The established expat community here means you'll never feel isolated—English is widely spoken, and there's a welcoming network of international residents who've made this charming coastal town their forever home.

With year-round Mediterranean sunshine, pristine Blue Flag beaches within 20 minutes, and comprehensive healthcare facilities with English-speaking doctors, this bungalow offers retirees the freedom to enjoy life at a relaxed pace. Whether you're looking for a permanent residence or a smart investment property (typical weekly rentals: €800), this home delivers genuine value and lifestyle quality.
areaSection:
Pilar de La Horadada sits on the southern Costa Blanca, blessed with 320+ days of annual sunshine and mild winters that make it ideal for retirees escaping colder climates. This charming coastal town offers authentic Spanish character without the over-tourism of larger resorts. The municipality stretches from the Mar Menor inland, creating a diverse geography with both beachfront developments and peaceful residential areas like Mil Palmeras.

The area's popularity has grown steadily among northern Europeans seeking a genuine lifestyle change rather than temporary holidays. Pilar de La Horadada maintains a relaxed, unhurried pace—you'll find Spanish traditions still strong, with weekly markets, family-run restaurants, and a genuine community atmosphere. The strategic location places you between the bustling marina areas and quieter inland villages, offering the best of both worlds.
lifestyleSection:
Daily life in Pilar de La Horadada revolves around enjoying simple pleasures: morning walks along Blue Flag beaches, afternoon café culture, and dinner with friends in welcoming local restaurants. The established expat community has created an infrastructure of support—from English-speaking doctors and legal advisors to social clubs, sports groups, and cultural events. You'll find everything you need within easy reach: modern supermarkets like Mercadona and Lidl, weekly markets bursting with fresh local produce, and healthcare facilities that rival anything in northern Europe.

The climate enables year-round outdoor living. Golf enthusiasts will find several championship courses nearby, while beach lovers enjoy easy access to pristine Mediterranean coastlines. Public transport connects you throughout the region, though many residents prefer the independence of a car for exploring charming inland villages and the broader Costa Blanca. The pace here suits retirees perfectly—active enough to stay engaged, relaxed enough to truly unwind.
investmentSection:
Beyond personal enjoyment, this property presents solid investment fundamentals. Pilar de La Horadada's market has appreciated 8% year-on-year—a consistent trend reflecting growing international interest. At €349,000, you're acquiring property 40% below comparable Spanish island markets, suggesting room for appreciation as the area continues its upward trajectory.

Rental potential is genuine: similar 2-bedroom properties in this location generate approximately €800 per week during peak season, translating to €40,000+ annually from summer letting alone. Many retirees use this income to offset their own residence costs or fund travel. The broader Costa Blanca property market continues strengthening, with foreign buyers increasingly recognizing value in established communities like this. Whether you intend to live here year-round or seasonally, the investment metrics support the purchase decision.
conclusion:
This bungalow in Mil Palmeras represents more than a property purchase—it's an investment in a relaxed retirement lifestyle backed by financial fundamentals. At €349,000, you're acquiring a premium-specification home in an established expat community with excellent healthcare, year-round sunshine, and proven investment appreciation.

Whether your priority is escaping northern winters, accessing affordable Mediterranean living, or generating rental income alongside personal use, this property delivers genuine value. The established support networks here mean you'll never feel isolated, while the authentic Spanish character keeps daily life engaging and interesting.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca en bra plats att köpa fastighet?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca remains one of Europe's most attractive property markets, particularly for retirees. The region offers 320+ days of annual sunshine, established expat communities, excellent healthcare, and strong investment fundamentals with consistent year-on-year appreciation. Pilar de La Horadada specifically combines affordability with authentic Spanish character and modern amenities.

faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-EU citizens can purchase property in Spain with no restrictions. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), and we recommend engaging a qualified property lawyer familiar with international purchases. The process is straightforward, and most vendors expect international buyers. British, Australian, American, and other nationality buyers regularly purchase in this region without complications.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs of 6-8%: property transfer tax (3%), notary fees (0.5-1%), land registry fees (0.5%), and legal/administration costs (1-2%). Ongoing costs include annual property tax (0.4-1.1%), community fees if applicable, and utilities. These remain significantly lower than equivalent ownership costs in most northern European countries.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca bra för pensionärer?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is excellent for retirees, offering year-round warm climate, affordable living costs (30-40% less than northern Europe), quality healthcare with English-speaking doctors, and established international communities providing social support and practical assistance. The relaxed lifestyle, beach access, and lower cost of living make it increasingly popular with UK and European retirees.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Pilar de La Horadada is significantly lower than northern Europe. Groceries cost 30-40% less, dining out averages €10-15 for good meals, utility bills are substantially lower, and healthcare is affordable even without Spanish health insurance. A comfortable retirement lifestyle costs approximately 40% less than equivalent living in the UK.

faqs.question: Kan jag få ett bolån i Spanien som utlänning?
faqs.answer: Yes, several Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically covering 60-70% of property value. Requirements usually include proof of income, credit checks, and NIE registration. Interest rates are competitive with other European markets. Many retirees purchase outright, but mortgages are available for those preferring to spread payments.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 320+ days of annual sunshine. Summer temperatures average 28-30°C (82-86°F), while winters are mild at 12-16°C (54-61°F). Rainfall is minimal, concentrated in autumn and spring. This climate enables year-round outdoor activities—beach visits in winter are genuinely pleasant, not merely tolerable.

faqs.question: Hur långt är det från Sverige till Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is 45 minutes from Pilar de La Horadada and offers multiple daily flights to UK cities (typically 2.5-3 hours flight time). Budget airlines like Ryanair and EasyJet operate regular routes, making UK visits convenient and affordable. Direct flights mean family members can visit easily, and you can return home quickly if needed.

faqs.question: Vilken hyresintäkt kan jag förvänta mig från denna fastighet?
faqs.answer: Similar 2-bedroom properties in Pilar de La Horadada generate approximately €800 per week during peak summer season, potentially reaching €40,000+ annually from letting alone. Off-season weekly rates are €500-600. Many retirees use rental income to offset their residence costs or fund travel, making this a practical investment alongside personal use.
